com.phunware.advertising

Class PwRewardedVideoAd

  • java.lang.Object
    • RewardVideoAdImpl
      • com.phunware.advertising.PwRewardedVideoAd

  • public class PwRewardedVideoAd
extends RewardVideoAdImpl
    Rewarded Video are full screen ads that display a video ad in their own Activity and return to the publisher app an event to assign a reward to the user Rewarded Video are best used at discrete stopping points in your app's flow, such as at the end of a game level, or when the player dies.

    Simple example:

     PwRewardedVideoAd rewardedVideoAd = PwRewardedVideoAd.getInstance(context, zoneId);
 rewardedVideoAd.show(); // reward video is loaded and shown asynchronously
    Instances of PwRewardedVideoAd are not safe for use by multiple threads.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  PwRewardedVideoAd.PwRewardedVideoAdListener
      Implement this interface to be notified of rewarded video ad lifecycle changes.

        public String getZone()

      • isTestMode

        public boolean isTestMode()
        Return if in test mode. In test mode, sample ad data is returned from the server. Default value is false.
        Returns:
        true if in test mode.

      • setTestMode

        public void setTestMode(boolean testMode)
        Enable or disable test mode. In test mode, sample ad data is returned from the server. Default value is false.
        Parameters:
        testMode -

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded()
        Used to determine if an ad is ready to be shown.
        Returns:
        true if ready for display, false otherwise

      • load

        public void load()
        Fire off an asynchronous request to the server for an ad. Use isLoaded() or PwRewardedVideoAd.PwRewardedVideoAdListener to determine when an ad is loaded.

      • show

        public void show()
        Display interstitial to user. If an ad is not loaded, load() will be called and the ad will be loaded and shown asynchronously. Use isLoaded() or PwRewardedVideoAd.PwRewardedVideoAdListener to determine when an ad is loaded.
